articles.author: Bloomberg News
articles.title: North American stocks sink as stagflation specter haunts trading - BNN
articles.description: The surge in stocks that followed the Federal Reserve decision proved short lived, with traders worried that officials could struggle to fight persistently high inflation amid the lingering threat of a recession.

articles.title: Canada is open to Americans who may lose access to abortions, but there's a catch - POLITICO
articles.description: While the offers from Trudeau's government and providers are sincere, the reality is that access in Canada is complicated and "wait lists are through the roof."
articles.content:
Political reaction in Canada to the draft Supreme Court opinion has been swift, with no shortage of posturing. Americans have always been free to travel to Canada for medical care, for example.

articles.author: Matthew Lodge
articles.title: Woman and teenager plead guilty over 115lb American bully dog named 'Beast' who mauled boy to death - Daily Mail
articles.description: Schoolboy Jack Lis, 10, was mauled to death by the 115lb American bully when he went to a friend's house after school in Pentwyn, Penyrheol, near Caephilly, Wales, on November 8, last year
articles.content:
A woman and a teenager have pleaded guilty to being in charge of a 115lb dog called 'Beast' that mauled a schoolboy to death.

articles.author: Vishwam Sankaran
articles.title: Pig heart transplanted into dying man in breakthrough operation was infected with virus, report says - Independent.ie
articles.description: An American man who died two months after receiving the first-ever human heart transplant from a pig may have been the victim of a pig virus infection, a new report said.
articles.content:
